storyInfo: Arturia escapes from prison. The Güldenesgesatz is tampered with, causing the Witch King's power to engulf the amphitheater. Viviana is forced to face the painful truth: Cora is the leader of the Witch King's remnants.

attributes.text: I was fifteen when I entered the Witch King's Spire.
I came from an ordinary family in Kreis Einwald. I should not have been able to become a noble's attendant, but I heard that Herkunftshorn made no distinction between nobles and commoners.
This was not because he treated commoners particularly well, but because he looked down equally on all who cowered at the foot of his throne.
At first, my job was to clean his instruments. But Herkunftshorn no longer played ordinary music, and those instruments had no meaning.
Later, I was sent to clean the resonance pipelines at the top of the Spire. It was not a difficult job, but Herkunftshorn would not tolerate even a single speck of dust in them.
My colleagues came and went. Few got to leave on their own two feet. In the end, I was the only one left, quietly cleaning at the top of the tower.
And a thousand sunrises and sunsets later, the Witch King's Spire fell.

attributes.content: Cut off the way down.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Attention all squads. Find the Sankta. Do not allow her to enter the amphitheater and interrupt the performance of the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The target is known to use unusual Arts. You have permission to kill if necessary.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Hello. Were you looking for me?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: —Barrier up!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Get in formation! Catch her!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia Giallo.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Leithanien took you in when you became a pariah in Laterano. Countless nobles honored you for your remarkable musical talent.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The Kaiserinnen granted you rights equivalent to spire nobility.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: So return to your cell and submit to them, and they may yet allow you to live.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: That was never an option.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What point is there to living if I can't play freely?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Then accept your death.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Your Arts have gotten stronger.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You missed your chance to break out, Sankta.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: The Güldenesgesatz is in progress. Do you see the scene outside? Your parlor tricks are meaningless before the golden glory of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Yes, I can feel that your will is firmer than ever.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But is it your will expressing that music, or has the melody convinced you that what you see is what you think?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: That's irrelevant. The golden melody guides me. My will echoes along with it!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: You, our enemy, will melt before Leithanien's radiance—
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: ...She's gone?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: An illusion? But there was no music!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Why does everyone keep assuming that I create illusions?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I warned you. When your emotions are being controlled by a melody that doesn't belong to yourself, you can easily overlook the reality before you... Like where I moved to in that 'radiance.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Behind—
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Barrier— too late—
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Now, I would like to ask you to kindly remove the Arts cast on my instrument.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: There, it's clean now. Danke.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How did we... lose to you?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Normally I wouldn't stand a chance, but your souls have become stiff and inflexible due to the bindings of the Güldenesgesatz, creating innumerable weaknesses in your Arts.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But... why? With Arts like these, you could have changed your destiny, enjoyed wealth, fame, and favor beyond reckoning... What meaning is there in defying the Kaiserinnen?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Hm, I think we have very different views on the meaning of meaning.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Fame, fortune, status... All merely accessories to a soul that will eventually wither and rot with the passage of time.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Kurfürst, beggar, or myself, the only difference is in the whispers of our hearts.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I want to climb the tallest spire. Because of a melody, a soul, and a future.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And for a promise I made to a friend.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Ten years had passed since the death of the Witch King. I was attending the funeral of an old friend.
After the funeral, I saw a Sankta with her cello in the amphitheater below the Twin Spires. Others came and went, but she stood there from noon until sundown.

attributes.content: According to legend, even the clouds stopped for the Witch King when he played up on his spire.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I wonder... do the clouds remember what the Spire looked like back then?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: I suppose not. Clouds change so quickly, after all.

attributes.content: My teacher often told me of how he stood beneath the Witch King's Spire while it was still standing, playing for the sole sovereign of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The golden-red clouds embraced the dark spire like an extravagant robe.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He wanted to come back and see the spectacle again, but wasn't allowed to participate in Das Kaiserinnensfest. In fact, he could barely get permission to leave his home.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Herr Emmanuel was one of the Witch King's musicians, after all, even if just for a short while. Times were hard for him after the Witch King's demise.

attributes.content: Few came to say their goodbyes, and you were the only one to truly shed tears for him.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: I heard your playing at the funeral. It was very touching.

attributes.content: Danke.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But that doesn't bring even the slightly bit of comfort to my teacher.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I asked to play for him while he was still alive, but he refused. During his days of pain and hardship, he refused to dwell on the happiness of the past, nor did he seek any change.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: He simply shut himself in his room, playing the Güldenesgesatz over and over again.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Through that unchanging melody, he drowned himself in Leithanien's greatness. Forgetting love, forgetting hate, and forgetting himself.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Yet, when faced with death, his heart was still filled with... regret.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: I've heard far too much regret over these long years.
My image of Herr Emmanuel remained that of the energetic old man who thanked you with a hearty laugh when you passed him his instrument.
I heard that, in the end, he was too weak to even lift a bow.
I thought that without the shadow of the Witch King's Spire, the skies of Leithanien would change greatly.
I thought that, going from Vedunien to Zwillingstürme, from the Witch King's Spire to the Twin Empresses' Spires, the melody echoing in the dusk would be somehow different.
But both then and now, we are like the clouds, unable to control where we drift.

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: Why are you not going downstairs?
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: I have no interest in this sort of 'concert.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A melody that binds the listener's will is just another form of law.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How did you know—
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: As complex as your Arts are, their structure is clearly visible to those familiar with Originium Arts and music. In that sense, it's different from Laterano's law.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Music should come from the unrestrained breathing of the soul, but you turned it into a cornerstone of order, all to control people's wills and wear down their emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: True bonds between souls are growing weaker. People are increasingly unable to understand one another, unable to respect the emotions of one another, and as such do harm to one another.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Such a rigid melody is no music at all.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ugh—!
attributes.name: Imperial Caster

attributes.content: We're almost at the top. I should start preparing for the next piece, before this one ends.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It's almost time to make good on our promise, isn't it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: As you said, this is a good place to play... or listen.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Is this my deepest memory?

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Sorry.

attributes.content: Why apologize?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Very few have invited me to play their heart's music of their own accord. Most did whatever they could to escape. Yet you have bared your soul to me... For that, I am grateful, and overjoyed.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: I just thought I could show you the death of the Witch King through my memories.

attributes.content: My music simply follows the melody of your heart. It cannot decide what you recall. All I can do is feel your emotions, and recreate them.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Sounds like sculpting, then.

attributes.content: You could say that. I discover and record, rather than changing one's true visage.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: There is only one reason we cannot enter the Witch King's Spire in your memories.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Whenever you recall his death, there is a... hand that truly moves your emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A hand that grabbed you amidst that great flood of Arts.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Whose hand was it?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.text: Whose hand was it?
It was...

attributes.content: Look out!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They're coming one after another. Federico and I will try to hold them off.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're blind, and it's too risky. Grab my hand and stay close.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...You're so much like him.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You mean... my father?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: This is just like when he grabbed me under the Witch King's Spire... He grabbed the hand of a servant he'd never met, and protected me through one wave of Arts after another.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...You were in the Spire the night the Witch King died.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You never told me that was how you met.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I had just lost my sight, and was cowering before the half-collapsed stairs. Neither the Witch King's guards nor the Twins' soldiers would have paid any heed to a humble servant.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Instead, a squad from Sturmland found me.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It was led by Werner, looking for his missing father and brother in the Spire.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: His heart must have been fraught with worry, but he couldn't ignore me shivering in a corner, and pulled me out of the ruins himself.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...That sounds like him alright.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I would have done the same.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're both good people. Very good people.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It's such a shame that...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Why are you covering my ears?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No need to be afraid, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It'll pass. This will all pass.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: What's happening?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The music has changed.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's... It's hideous!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: My head... who's attacking me?! It's like someone stuffed a thousand screaming fowlbeasts into my brain!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: These fireworks, too! The colors! It's so crass!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: This is wrong. This isn't right. Am I playing it wrong? Is everyone wrong?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Herr from Sturmland? Are you alright?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: D-Don't touch me! I don't know who you are, and I don't want to know! Are you the one who played it wrong? Are you trying to break something? Everything?
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Ugh—euuggh!
attributes.name: Young Noble

attributes.content: Something went wrong with the melody?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But how could everyone be wrong at the same time?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And how could a simple mistake lead to something so... painful?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Look at the Twin Empresses' Spires.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It's him. Herkunftshorn. I'd recognize that anywhere. His power is eating away at the Güldenesgesatz!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The Witch King's remnants... where are they?! I knew there were some left. It's time to fight, Lessing!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...You're not affected?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: By a few dark clouds? After what I've had to live with in my head every day of my life?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...The Güldenesgesatz itself, though.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It made me miss Urtica. Now that is deeply disturbing.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: That's the power of the Movement.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It defines Leithanien and its beliefs.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I don't want someone else deciding what I should miss, what I should love, and what I should praise.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But I'm guessing that whoever it is that's sabotaging the performance is after more than just pranking the Kaiserinnen and the nobles outside Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Enemy on your left.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I know. Your side, too.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Let's do this together.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I didn't think anyone would retain their senses.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: For once, I'm grateful for everything you've done to me. Pain and chaos in my brain are like old friends by now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...Good work.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You too.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: So why are you acting just fine while everyone else is in agony? I'm beginning to suspect that you're a Lich-sculpted wooden puppet.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I was trained from a very young age to deal with this kind of situation.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: And what kind of situation would that be?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The collapse of the Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: ...Please tell me you're joking.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you see the golden glow rising over the edge of the amphitheater?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: I've never seen so many Gesatzswächter in one place at the same time.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Her Majesty's order—
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Surround Gnade Avenue and Macht Avenue.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Do not allow the corrupted Güldenesgesatz to spread.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: So many Gesatzswächter... and Gendarmerie.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The entire Zwillingstürmeshof will be on lockdown before long.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Haha, it's no use! It's too late.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn is back! The one true king has returned to a Leithanien that rightfully belongs to him!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Quiet, please.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: We're leaving.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Cora, please, promise me... Don't say or do anything for now.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I might have tried something if it were just Herr Reiner, but there are too many of them, and each one the equal of a Knight-Champion.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why do you not speak? Why should we hide now that the curtain is about to rise?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Our dream, our obsession, the moment for which we have given both blood and soul is finally upon us!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: So why is there no joy on your face?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Concertm—
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: I told you to be quiet.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You knew.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Since when?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I visited Marigold Alley before I went to see Arturia.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I wanted to see those drawings again, the images that gave me such warmth.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But I didn't find anything.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: All the drawings, the ones with marigolds in them, the ones with clues leading to the Witch King... All gone.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You took them, didn't you?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I only needed to take the ones containing the clues.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But I couldn't bear to part with the marigolds either.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...My suspicions were confirmed the moment you told me that you were there the night the Witch King died.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: When you cleaned the canvas back then, you left a spot untouched. The part showing you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Witch King's remnants were after witnesses to the Witch King's death.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And you were one of them.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But you're different from the others. You're not an innocent victim.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I... didn't want to say it. I didn't even want to ask.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why... couldn't I be selfish, just this once?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I really am sorry, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why do I have to lose something I only just found?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: We should fight together, Concertmaster.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Gesatzswächter are here. We've come so far. It would be a shame to die at their hands now.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.text: The amphitheater is a scene of chaos.
The tuning continues. The Ludwigs-Universität incident already proved that only the Kaiserinnen could fight Herkunftshorn's Arts.
What would the Twins think of my little show of selfishness, of betrayal?
I am not especially concerned.

attributes.content: ...Do you believe that the Güldenesgesatz can completely change its tone?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: I only care about the result.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The last person to rewrite the Güldenesgesatz was Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: But even he did not consider its destruction.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: The Movement is the foundation on which Leithanien is built.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Its destruction will undermine everything. Our aesthetics, our habits and usage of Arts, the Kurfürsten system, the imperial authority...
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: It will bring unprecedented change to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: But change isn't necessarily bad. If it were, we would never have been born.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: A pair of children born of Arts, in defiance of the laws of nature.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: 'This is just the beginning.'
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That's what Fremont said to Leopold. We were but infants at the time, but I know you understood what they said as well as I did.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: We were born with a duty.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: A duty to change Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Leopold was afraid of us. Which is why he had an army ready to tear us apart from behind the moment we killed Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: But we survived.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...We may not have chosen to be born, but once we were, we had the right to live.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Twenty-three years ago, we stood here gazing at the same sunset, over an altogether different scene of chaos.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You extended your hand to me before we began our long-awaited duet.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You said...
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: This sunset doesn't belong to anyone.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Not to Herkunftshorn, not to Leopold, not to the Kurfürsten, nor to any other ambitious noble.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You took my hand, and we walked here together.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: There's no need to answer to the Kurfürsten... No need to be manipulated by anyone.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Our fate is ours alone to decide.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: And apparently... someone else shares the same desire.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Such a curious thing, the human soul.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: To think that even artificial children would learn human desire after gaining souls.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: That through a wish as simple as can be, the meek may be able to accomplish what even Herkunftshorn failed to, and redefine Leithanien.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You want to ask whether I let Cora roam free on purpose, don't you?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Are you not of the same mind on this matter? Our thoughts are linked, even if it's been a long time since the two of us have watched the sunset together.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Let's stay a while. It won't take long.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...Very well.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: What will the future look like?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Would you still watch it with me, Hildegard?
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Where's Cora?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Viviana?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.text: I could hear Brandt's voice. He's fighting the remaining cultists. They won't last long.
But the other is even faster.
Viviana is silent, but her Arts draw closer. I feel a shadow creep over the top of my foot, as cold as a storm at night.

attributes.content: Look out, Concertmaster!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Concertmaster—
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: How... my Arts... went through...
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: This is... tuning? Why...
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Amelie. Like I said, my decision has never changed.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Ha... haha... it's nothing. We've betrayed so many in our lifetimes... perhaps too many.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn's eternal spire... It's so close... I'll be waiting for you... on the stairs...
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: ...Concertmaster.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Amelie must have turned to dark dust before me. This is how it is for the Witch King's followers. They don't want their bodies to linger on a land that lacks Herkunftshorn's favor.
She's dead.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Most of them are. The remaining resistance will not last long.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...And the same for me, I suppose.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You deceived the followers of Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja. The Kaiserin's instruction was to become the Concertmaster of the Witch King's followers. To become a hope and a lure, and to lead them into the abyss by their own volition.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It's been twenty-three years. Everything about the Witch King—the long nightmares, the deep-rooted fears, the meaningless ambition—should have been gone from this country a long time ago.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: So why is the 'tuning' still going?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Because...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Werner.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Did the Kaiserin order father's death?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...I tried to persuade him. I tried so hard.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I wanted him to hand over the copy of Güldenesgesatz, so I could move it elsewhere, but he was concerned that the Witch King remnants would catch on, thus nullifying the bait.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I asked him if maybe Brandt could arrive at the scene earlier, and save him at the scene of the attack... but he refused.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: He said he was already dying, and would soon get to see Lucinda. A few more days wasn't worth dragging both you and Sturmland into it.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But you'd have gotten there if only he'd held out for a few more hours... or less.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: He was too determined to leave, and gave up too easily.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The day Werner died, I recovered the copy of the Movement and watched you return to Sturmland, walking the path paved for you, so similar to his...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: And I made the choice that had long been brewing in my heart.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...The Güldenesgesatz.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're using Herkunftshorn's Arts to tune the music. You're trying to destroy it, or rather the influence it holds over all Leithanians.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They say that fate is an endless spiral staircase.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: If so, the Güldenesgesatz is the staircase trapping Leithanien.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Stairs built a thousand years ago, glorious and beautiful on the outside, yet rotted to the core on the inside.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I've seen so many people trapped within. Herr Emmanuel, Gerhard, Frieda, Loris... and Brandt. All suffering the tidings of fate, helpless to change it.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Witch King's Spire fell. Yet more rose to take its place. Those beneath the spires wish to climb them, while those atop them aspire to an even higher perch.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: They come and go, up and down, an endless waltz of hatred and conflict. Pain, sorrow and regret, filling the souls of one generation of Leithanians after another.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You too, Viviana. Once you enter the Kaiserinnen's Spires, you will only speak what they want you to.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can 'see'... I have already seen how you will be forced to live a life you don't want, just like your father before you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Güldenesgesatz never changes. Leithanien never changes. Tragedy never changes.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Unless we free ourselves from the Movement of the past.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You say you want to change our fate. But who are you to decide who gets saved, and who gets sacrificed?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I can't. It's not my place, nor is it anyone's.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You want to destroy the old order. But where is the new order? Can you guarantee it will be better than yesterday or today?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I can't. Our future isn't for someone like me to decide.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Those who died for the plan, and the people right before us... don't you realize the pain they're in?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I hear them. Their screams, their laments... I will never stop hearing them, not until the day I die.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Then why do you have to be the one to change everything?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Because... I can.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: That's the only reason?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Someone has to. My life never had much meaning to begin with, except for one speck of light that never fully belonged to me. And I would do anything to keep it from going out.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can't condone your cruelty, arrogance, or irresponsibility.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And as such, I must stop you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Disaster has already struck, and by my hand. I've caused so much death, with even more to come.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Just stop this.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I can't. Not after what it took to get this far.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Do you know what it is about your actions I agree with the least?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You really are...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Heartless.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: No—!
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter
Gesatzswächter
attributes.content: Viviana...

attributes.name: Gesatzswächter
attributes.content: Cora, Cora!
I know, I know.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're soft on the outside, but firm on the inside. You just can't turn your back on other people's pain.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You don't want to make things difficult for Brandt either. You're always thinking of others, even now.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: And... I'm glad I got to die at the hands of the one I love the most.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Are the clouds beautiful today?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: No need to be afraid, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It'll pass. This will all...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She embraces me.
I can feel her hand on my back, trembling.
I want to hug her and comfort her like I used to. Perhaps I did. I talked so much, even though I had already begun to go numb from blood loss.
I can imagine her lake-like eyes beginning to rain, her gentle complexion warped by torment.
She only just learned that I've never clearly seen the faces of her father and mother.
Through Werner's words, I could only imagine how they looked, how they met, and how they fell in love.
After all, I went into that dark spire the day I came to Vedunien. And the day I left it, I could no longer see.
Everything I know that's nice and beautiful, including Brandt, was brought to me by Werner and Lucinda.
Except for one thing... except this.
The day that Werner brought the girl down from the spire to me, the day that I touched her soft, timid hand, the day that I wiped away her tears...
That was the day that I became certain of it.
I loved this child, and not because she was their daughter.
But because I saw in her something that none of us had.
You deserve a better life than this, Viviana... If there really is one...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.text: Twenty-three years ago, I heard the sound of fighting from below, and gave the resonance pipeline at the top of the Spire a little push.
Just a little push, something anyone could do.
It created the tiniest gap in Herkunftshorn's defensive Arts. He had never imagined that a humble maidservant would have the courage to betray him.
Today, I tampered with the resonance pipelines of the Twin Empresses' Spires.
All I did was restore the Witch King's tuning components, according to the Arts he left behind in the copy of the Güldenesgesatz, then activate them with my own humble Arts.
Life is too short.
Do nothing, and you leave no trace behind, like the clouds floating past the spires.
But no one should drift with the wind like that, unable to determine their own future.
Many desires change. I'm just the first to extend my hand.
I hope that after this, all good people, all the people I love...
Will have a true future.
